page.title: 15Industry In South Kyme
page.content: As this is almost entirely a farming area, there is little industry. The main business in the village is an Agricultural Engineers, run by the 4th. generation of one family. Originally this was a blacksmiths business, chiefly working in farriery and repairing horse ploughs, harrows, corn binders and hand tools. Now the type of work has changed to making, repairing and supplying spare parts to large modern machines. These include hydraulic harrows, drags, potato and beet harvesters, and combines. Some work is still carried out on the original forge and anvils, but modern methods of electric and oxy-acetylene welding, and power driven grinders, cutters, and drop hammer are now used. Other industry:a firm specializing in designing/making precision machinery, and a building/joinery firm.
